alert.note: Alert for Custer; Fallon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 30 at 4:35PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CENTRAL FALLON...SOUTHEASTERN CUSTER AND NORTHWESTERN CARTER COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM MDT... At 434 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 34 miles west of Baker to 25 miles northwest of Ekalaka to 21 miles north of Volborg. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ekalaka, Mizpah, Medicine Rocks State Park, and Willard. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
